definitions: person who attempts to undermine or overthrow established authority or institutions
something that challenges or disrupts traditional values or systems
examples: The government arrested several subversives for distributing anti-establishment pamphlets
Political subversives often work secretly to avoid detection by authorities
The artist's work was considered subversive to traditional aesthetic values
This subversive film challenges conventional ideas about family structure

definitions: underground railway system used for public transportation in cities
underground passage allowing pedestrians to cross beneath a road
examples: She takes the subway to work every morning to avoid traffic
The New York subway operates twenty-four hours a day
Use the subway to safely cross this busy intersection
The subway beneath the highway connects both sides of town

definitions: loudspeaker designed specifically to reproduce low-frequency bass sounds
examples: The subwoofer adds deep bass to the home theater system
He placed the subwoofer in the corner for optimal sound distribution

definitions: series of things following one after another in order
process of inheriting a title, office, or property from predecessor
examples: A succession of storms battered the coastal region last week
The rapid succession of changes left everyone feeling overwhelmed
The succession to the throne follows strict hereditary rules
Questions about succession arose when the CEO announced retirement

definitions: person who takes over a position or role from someone else
thing that comes after and replaces something else
examples: The board appointed her successor before she retired from office
Finding a suitable successor for the legendary coach proved difficult
This smartphone model is the successor to last year's bestseller
The new software serves as a successor to the outdated system

definitions: plant with thick fleshy leaves or stems that store water
type of food that is tender and juicy when cooked
examples: She grows various succulents in her desert garden collection
Succulents require minimal watering and thrive in dry conditions
The chef prepared a succulent roast that melted in our mouths
These succulent peaches are perfect for making summer desserts

definitions: person who is easily deceived or taken advantage of
device that adheres to surfaces using vacuum or adhesion
shoot growing from the base or roots of a plant
examples: Don't be a sucker for those get-rich-quick schemes online
The con artist targeted suckers with promises of easy money
The octopus uses suckers on its tentacles to grip surfaces
Attach the phone mount using the suction cup sucker
Remove the suckers from tomato plants to improve fruit production
Rose bushes often produce suckers that should be pruned away

definitions: act of drawing something in by creating partial vacuum with mouth
feeding behavior of infants drawing milk from breast or bottle
examples: The sucking sound indicated a leak in the vacuum seal
Excessive thumb sucking can affect children's dental development
The baby's sucking reflex is essential for proper feeding
Proper sucking technique ensures adequate nutrition for newborns

definitions: baby that is still feeding on mother's milk
young animal that has not yet been weaned from nursing
examples: The mother cradled her suckling close during the feeding session
Medieval paintings often depict Mary with the suckling Christ child
The farmer separated the sucklings from their mothers for weaning
A piglet is called a suckling until it stops nursing

definitions: force created by partial vacuum that draws objects together or holds them
examples: The vacuum cleaner uses suction to remove dirt from carpets
Strong suction from the drain pulled the toy down the pipe

definitions: logic puzzle where players fill grid with digits following specific rules
examples: She completes the newspaper sudoku puzzle during her lunch break
This sudoku app offers puzzles ranging from easy to expert level

definitions: leather with soft napped surface made from underside of animal skin
examples: His suede jacket requires special cleaning to maintain its texture
These suede shoes look elegant but need protection from water

definitions: hard fat around kidneys and loins of cattle or sheep used in cooking
examples: Traditional Christmas pudding contains suet for richness and moisture
Birds love suet feeders during cold winter months for energy

definitions: person who experiences pain, distress, or hardship
someone affected by a particular illness or condition
examples: The charity provides support services for chronic pain sufferers
War sufferers need both medical care and psychological support
Allergy sufferers often struggle during spring pollen season
Depression sufferers benefit from professional treatment and understanding

definitions: state of having enough of something to meet needs
condition of being able to provide for oneself without external help
examples: They questioned the sufficiency of emergency food supplies for winter
The sufficiency of evidence determined the outcome of the trial
The community strives for sufficiency in food and energy production
Economic sufficiency allows nations to resist external pressures

definitions: letter or group of letters added to end of word to change meaning
examples: The suffix '-ness' turns adjectives into nouns like 'kindness'
Adding the suffix '-ed' creates the past tense of regular verbs

definitions: death or unconsciousness caused by lack of oxygen or inability to breathe
overwhelming feeling of being unable to breathe or being oppressed
examples: The cause of death was determined to be suffocation by smoke
Proper ventilation prevents suffocation risks in confined spaces
She felt a sense of suffocation in the overcrowded subway car
The suffocation of creativity in rigid corporate environments frustrates employees

definitions: right to vote in political elections granted to citizens
examples: Women's suffrage was achieved after decades of persistent activism
Universal suffrage ensures all adult citizens can participate in democracy

definitions: woman who campaigned for women's right to vote in early twentieth century
examples: The suffragette chained herself to railings in protest for voting rights
Many suffragettes endured imprisonment for their activism and civil disobedience

definitions: person who advocates for extending voting rights to disenfranchised groups
examples: The suffragist movement included both women and men fighting for equality
Suffragists used peaceful methods unlike the more militant suffragettes

definitions: tall tropical grass plant cultivated for sugar production from its stems
examples: Sugarcane fields stretch for miles in tropical agricultural regions
Workers harvest sugarcane by cutting the tall stalks at ground level

definitions: quality of being right or appropriate for particular purpose or situation
degree to which something matches requirements or expectations
examples: The committee will assess each candidate's suitability for the position
They questioned the suitability of the venue for such a large event
The soil's suitability for growing grapes makes this region ideal for vineyards
Psychological testing determines suitability for high-stress occupations

definitions: rectangular case with handle used for carrying clothes when traveling
examples: She packed her suitcase carefully for the two-week business trip
The airline lost his suitcase during the connecting flight

definitions: cloth or fabric specifically made for manufacturing suits
examples: The tailor showed various suiting options for the custom business suit
High-quality wool suiting drapes well and resists wrinkles

definitions: man who courts a woman with intention of marriage
person who makes a formal request or petition in legal matters
examples: Several suitors competed for her attention at the debutante ball
Her father interviewed each suitor to assess their intentions
The suitor filed a petition with the court for custody rights
Multiple suitors submitted bids to acquire the bankrupt company

definitions: chemical compound containing sulfur combined with another element
examples: Hydrogen sulfide produces the characteristic rotten egg smell
Metal sulfides are important ores for extracting various metals

definitions: yellow nonmetallic element used in chemicals, explosives, and medicines
examples: Sulfur deposits near volcanic areas appear as yellow crystalline formations
The sulfur content in diesel fuel is regulated for environmental protection

definitions: salt or ester of sulfuric acid containing SO4 group
examples: Copper sulphate solution appears bright blue and kills algae in pools
Magnesium sulphate, known as Epsom salt, soothes sore muscles

definitions: compound of sulphur with another element or radical
examples: Iron sulphide forms when iron reacts with sulphur at high temperatures
Lead sulphide was historically used as an eye cosmetic called kohl

definitions: British spelling of sulfur, a yellow nonmetallic chemical element
examples: Sulphur springs emit a distinctive smell from dissolved minerals
The sulphur mines operated for decades before environmental concerns arose

definitions: sovereign ruler of certain Muslim countries, especially Ottoman Empire
person holding supreme authority in a particular domain
examples: The sultan ruled the Ottoman Empire from his palace in Istanbul
Historical sultans commanded vast territories and military forces
He acts like the sultan of the kitchen, controlling every detail
The media sultan owns multiple television networks and newspapers

definitions: wife, mother, sister, or daughter of a sultan
light-colored seedless raisin made from specific grape variety
examples: The sultana lived in the harem section of the palace
Historical sultanas often wielded significant political influence behind scenes
Add sultanas to the fruit cake for natural sweetness
These golden sultanas are perfect for baking and snacking

definitions: country or territory ruled by a sultan
period during which a sultan rules
examples: The Sultanate of Oman maintains a strategic position on shipping routes
Several sultanates emerged after the empire's fragmentation
The sultanate lasted three centuries before transitioning to republic
During his sultanate, arts and sciences flourished throughout the realm

definitions: shrub or small tree with compound leaves and clusters of flowers
tangy crimson spice made from dried and ground sumac berries
examples: Wild sumac grows along roadsides displaying brilliant fall colors
Poison sumac causes severe skin reactions and should be avoided
Sprinkle sumac on hummus for authentic Middle Eastern flavor
The chef uses sumac to add lemony tartness without liquid

definitions: process or result of adding things together to find total
final summary that brings together all important points
examples: The summation of all expenses exceeded the original budget estimate
Mathematical summation involves adding a sequence of numbers
The lawyer's summation brilliantly tied together all the evidence
His book provides a summation of twentieth-century political thought

definitions: season or period of summer, typically associated with warm weather and vacation
examples: Children enjoy the freedom of summertime without school obligations
The beach becomes crowded during summertime weekends

definitions: act of calling upon someone or something to appear or come
formal legal order requiring appearance in court
examples: The summoning of emergency services saved lives during the disaster
Ancient texts describe the summoning of spirits through ritual
The judge issued a summoning for all witnesses to testify
Failure to respond to court summoning results in legal consequences

definitions: traditional Japanese wrestling where opponents try to force each other out of ring
examples: Sumo wrestlers follow strict training regimens and dietary requirements
The ancient sport of sumo maintains deep cultural significance in Japan

definitions: pit or reservoir for collecting liquids or waste water
lowest part of engine crankcase serving as oil reservoir
examples: The basement sump collects groundwater to prevent flooding
Install a sump pump to automatically remove accumulated water
Check the engine sump regularly to ensure adequate oil levels
The mechanic drained oil from the sump during routine maintenance

definitions: beam or ray of sunlight shining through opening or clouds
examples: Dust particles danced in the sunbeam streaming through the window
The cat stretched out lazily in a warm sunbeam on the floor

definitions: reddening and inflammation of skin caused by overexposure to sun
examples: Her painful sunburn required aloe vera treatment after the beach day
Prevent sunburn by applying sunscreen thirty minutes before sun exposure

definitions: sudden appearance of bright sunlight through clouds
decorative design with rays emanating from central point
examples: A dramatic sunburst illuminated the landscape after the storm
The sunburst through the clouds created a spectacular photo opportunity
The vintage guitar features an attractive sunburst finish
She wore a sunburst brooch that had belonged to her grandmother

definitions: ice cream dessert topped with syrup, nuts, whipped cream, and cherry
examples: The children ordered hot fudge sundaes with extra whipped cream
This restaurant serves elaborate sundaes with multiple toppings

definitions: device that shows time by position of shadow cast by sun
examples: The ancient sundial in the garden still accurately indicates noon
Before mechanical clocks, people relied on sundials for timekeeping

definitions: time when sun disappears below horizon in the evening
examples: The park closes at sundown for safety and security reasons
We need to reach camp before sundown to set up safely

definitions: small freshwater fish with deep, compressed body found in North America
large ocean fish with flattened circular body also called mola
examples: Children caught several sunfish from the pond using simple hooks
Bluegill sunfish are popular targets for beginning anglers
The ocean sunfish can weigh over two thousand pounds
Divers photographed a massive sunfish near the reef

definitions: tall plant with large yellow flower head that turns to follow sun
examples: The sunflower field attracted tourists who came for photos
Sunflower seeds provide healthy snacks and cooking oil

definitions: time when sun first appears above eastern horizon in morning
examples: They woke early to watch the sunrise over the ocean
The sunrise painted the sky in brilliant shades of orange and pink
